description: From Middle English incomparable, from Middle French incomparable, from Old French [Term?], from Latin incomparābilis. Equivalent to in- +‎ comparable.

adjectives.description: incomparable (comparative more incomparable, superlative most incomparable)

entries.meaning: So much better than another as to be beyond comparison; matchless or unsurpassed.
examples: I know of nothing in all drama more incomparable from the point of view of art, nothing more suggestive in its subtlety of observation, than Shakespeare's drawing of Rosencrantz and Guildenstern.

entries.meaning: Something beyond compare; a thing with which there is no comparison.
